text: Le chef chante et cuisine à merveille !!! C'était délicieux et il est même venu nous saluer à la fin du repas ! Accueil très chaleureux. Merci

Événement Pasta-Opéra, environ une fois par mois, à ne pas manquer ! Un repas 5 services impeccable pour 99 $, taxes et service compris avec bonus, apporter votre vin. Cette soirée est agrémentée d'airs d'opéra chanté par nul autre que le chef propriétaire ténor Davide Bazzali accompagné d'un accordéoniste. Je me suis crue en Italie, c'était tout à fait magique ! Le service est attentif et fait avec soin. N'hésitez surtout pas, l'animation ne vient pas gâcher le repas ou vice-versa comme c'est souvent le cas !

Cute little place, bring your own wine is always fun. The waitress gave decent service but she seemed new and/or rushed. $40 for five courses is quite the bargain, and the presentation was nice. The problem was just the food: tastes bland, reheated from frozen (seemed to be one young hipster guy in the kitchen doing just that). They drown everything in either olive oil, sage butter or Kraft pseudo-parmesan to at least give it richness and cover up the blandness/lack of fresh ingredients. My beef ravioli were like sloppy joe's, pasta was overcooked. Honestly, for what you're paying it's an OK value. When I was a college student I loved going to these types of places on a Friday night. But if you like good Italian, this is a neighbourhood where you can pay a bit more and get a lot, lot more for it.

Cela faisait longtemps que je voulais essayer la table d'hôte du dimanche 5 services pour 40$ et l'attente en valait le coup !

Tous les plats que j'ai choisis étaient excellents, les portions parfaites !  Ils font leur propres pâtes et ça se goûte.  Excellent service, belle ambiance, mes amis et moi avons eu un très beau et bon moment.

Ce qui est encore mieux c'est que c'est un apportez votre vin, que demander de plus? 

J'ai déjà hâte à ma prochaine visite.

Nous sommes venus bruncher un dimanche. Il y a le choix parmi 6 assiettes variées et toutes plus appétissantes les unes que les autres. Nous avons pris la gourmande et n'avons pas été déçus : bonne et copieuse ! 
La salle est charmante, le personnel l'est tout autant. 
N'hésitez pas à demander la liste des smoothies du jour. Un délice.

Petit resto qui mérite d'être découvert. Les plats sont vraiment succulents, tout est fait sur place avec des ingrédients frais et de bonne qualité. Le menu change régulièrement, ce qui permet de goûter à différents plats. Les prix sont un peu élevés mais c'est un 'apportez votre vin' alors ça compense en ce sens. Le personnel est aussi très sympathique et professionnel. 

Le seul point négatif, même si ca n'enlève rien à la qualité des plat, est la décoration. J'imagine qu'ils ont voulu faire tendance en ayant de la vaisselle dépareillée. Selon moi ça ne s'accorde pas du tout au style du restaurant et ça fait même un peu bas de gamme. Aussi, juste à côté des toilettes il y a cadre avec un vrai serpent empaillé dedans. Quel choix étrange pour un restaurant, sachant qu'un serpent empaillé n'est pas super appétissant. Cela dit, ce sont des détails et ça ne m'empêche pas de mettre 5 étoiles.

Where do I begin? Il Bazzali serves up an Italian/french hybrid with a charming and aesthetically chic atmosphere- a real hidden gem nestled right near Beaubien metro. Davide, chef and owner, is always there with his team making the freshest and most exquisite dishes, whether you're there for brunch or supper (which says a lot here in Montreal.) 

The ravioli and pasta are handmade every day, and if you're lucky you can catch Davide serenading patrons with the dulcet tones of his opera singing (really!). The staff are attentive, kind, and truly care about your experience with the food and your time spent there. They take care of you.

 Most recently I went for brunch with my brunch gang and had The Classic- the typical eggs-sausage-bacon-and-patato-fare...but frankly, it put other restaurants' breakfasty attempts to shame. The eggs and baguette were nestled up to a gorgeous sausage- all cooked perfectly, and the potatoes were all that potatoes wish they could be, in thanks to the crisping magic of duck fat. The chefs have been whipping up smoothies lately; mine tasted like the edible manifestation of a pineapple cloud. 

All in all, this is the place to take your friends/clients to for that wow effect, for the ideal date, or to catch up with your ladies or fam. BYO wine too!

Very nice place. Cozy for a romantic diner. The food is AMAZING. So good! The team is very friendly as well and the ratio quality + quantity / price is perfect.

My new go to restaurant in Rosemont/Little Italy / Villeray. 

Love it!!

The opera singing chef was quite a stud, but unfortunately his food was a forgettable dud.

Bonus points for ambience and bring your own wine...but one visit was enough.
Just a great experience. Good food, great atmosphere, beautiful singing (make sure you go on a singing night)

I really wish these guys these best but I have to keep it real and bump this down a star based on my last experience. I ordered the fish and pasta main and it was quite expensive and I found it fine, but not mind blowing or delicious. Not a big deal. When the owner asked how I was enjoying it I said it was fine and instead asking any follow up questions he was shocked not to receive pure praise and made fun of the use of the word fine. Just a small moment but a bummer and it came back to me when I walked by recently and asked myself why I had stopped frequenting the establishment. I think the last thing people want or deserve when they are spending their hard earned moolah is to feel mocked or like their tastes don't matter or their business is unappreciated. 

Anyway, everything i said before still stands I'm sure! Cute place that seems to be doing well and i wish them only good things.

I am a big fan of this restaurant. My husband and I are so glad there is a quaint yet very good Italian restaurant in our neighborhood that is not over-priced and has the sweet charm and decor of Bazzali. We have come for lunch on several occasions while we have had only had dinner here once and sadly, we have yet to attend Davide Bazzali's singing dinner theatre, but we plan to try it at least once in the near future. My recommendation: come and discover the lunch menu... it changes all of the time and each day it boasts something new, fresh and delicious! Simply a charming restaurant in this increasingly hip section of Beaubien. Well done Mr. Bazzali !!!
